member.name: T:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.Application
member.summary: The main application interface for standalone applications using the Portal Dosimetry scripting API.
member.remarks: This class must not be used by plug-in scripts. It is intended for use by standalone applications only.

member.name: M:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.Application.#ctor(VMS.CA.Scripting.IDatabaseProvider,VMS.CA.Scripting.User)
member.summary: Constructor.

member.name: M:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.Application.CreateApplication(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates an application instance and logs into the ARIA system.
member.param: Username for logging in or null value to invoke an interactive login dialog.
Password for logging in or null value to invoke an interactive login dialog.
If true, the application is launched in demo mode using XML and DICOM files instead of the ARIA database. If false, the ARIA database is used as data source.
member.returns: Application object that is the root of the datamodel.
member.remarks: Dispose must be called before the program exits. Only one Application instance may be created during the entire run of the program.
member.exception: Thrown when an application object was already created.
Thrown when the application configuration file contains no or an invalid 'AssemblyPath' setting.
Thrown in case of other errors, e.g. login failed, required license not available or database connection problems.

member.name: M:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.Application.OpenPatient(VMS.CA.Scripting.PatientSummary)
member.summary: Opens a patient.
member.param: Patient summary. Call to find all patients on the database.
member.returns: Opened patient if found, null otherwise
member.remarks: Only one patient can be open at the same time.

member.name: M:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.Application.OpenPatientById(System.String)
member.summary: Opens a patient by using a patient identifier.
member.param: Patient ID
member.returns: Opened patient if found, null otherwise
member.remarks: Only one patient can be open at the same time.

member.name: T:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.DoseImage
member.summary: Represents a dose image (portal dose or predicted dose) in the Portal Dosimetry application. Wraps an image of type .
member.remarks:
When converting raw pixel values to dose values using the method, it needs to be considered that the resulting display value does not take normalization into account, except for the currently active dose image.
To get correct dose values using normalization, first create an analysis with and specify the desired normalization properties for the analysis. Finally get the linear transfer function to convert raw pixel values to dose values by calling the method .

member.name: M:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.DoseImage.GetMinMax(System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get the pixel raw values that represent the minimal and maximal dose in the image.
member.param: Returns the raw value representing the minimal dose
Returns the raw value representing the maximal dose
If true, the min and max values are found by cutting off 0.1 % at the ends of the histogram. This eliminates outliers.
member.remarks:
'Min' and 'max' means 'Minumum/maximum in display values'. Use the method to convert raw values to display values.
Consider that normalization is only done for the currently active dose image. All other dose images are using the display unit as stored in the database, e.g. Gy/MU for predicted doses.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.DoseImage.DoseImageMethodImpl
member.summary: Injected class method implementation.

member.summary: The dose image type.

member.summary: The original unit of this dose image.
member.remarks: Plug-in scripts only: The currently active image is normalized and therefore the original unit and the current unit may differ.

member.summary: The current unit of this dose image.
member.remarks: Plug-in scripts only: The currently active image is normalized and therefore the original unit and the current unit may differ.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.DoseImage.Visible
member.summary: Gets if this dose image is currently visible in the user interface, taking the plan filter and the 'Disposed' flag into account. For standalone scripting API applications, all plans are visible and disposed images have this flag set to false.

member.summary: Gets if this is a composite image.

member.summary: Used for navigating to the wrapped base image.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.DoseImage.ComposedImages
member.summary: The images this image is composed from if it is a composite image. Empty list if it is not a composite image.
member.remarks: The images in this collection are never composite images (no recursive composition possible).

member.name: T:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.NormalizationMethod
member.summary: The enumeration of normalization methods used in relative dosimetry.
member.remarks: The normalization defines what dose value is assumed to be 100 %

member.name: F:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.NormalizationMethod.Unknown
member.summary: Unknown or not applicable

member.name: F:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.NormalizationMethod.MaxPredictedDose
member.summary: Maximum in predicted dose is 100 %, portal dose is scaled accordingly

member.name: F:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.NormalizationMethod.MaxEachDose
member.summary: Maximum in each dose is 100 %

member.name: F:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.NormalizationMethod.Point
member.summary: Dose at user selected point is 100 %

member.name: F:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.NormalizationMethod.Isocenter
member.summary: Dose at isocenter point is 100 %

member.name: F:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.NormalizationMethod.MinimizeDifference
member.summary: Maximum in portal dose is 100 %, predicted dose is scaled to minimize the (quadratic) difference between predicted and portal dose

member.summary: The enumeration of evaluation tests that are available in an analysis.
member.remarks: All tests are only taking pixels inside of the region of interest (ROI) and in the defined dose threshold into account.

member.summary: Maximum gamma value of whole image

member.name: F:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.EvaluationTestKind.AverageGamma
member.summary: Average gamma value of whole image

member.name: F:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.EvaluationTestKind.GammaAreaAboveThreshold1
member.summary: Percent of area with gamma value above a user defined threshold 1

member.name: F:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.EvaluationTestKind.GammaAreaAboveThreshold2
member.summary: Percent of area with gamma value above a user defined threshold 2

member.name: F:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.EvaluationTestKind.MaxDoseDifference
member.summary: Maximum dose difference value of whole image in absolute mode

member.name: F:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.EvaluationTestKind.AverageDoseDifference
member.summary: Average dose difference value of whole image in absolute mode

member.name: F:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.EvaluationTestKind.DoseDiffAboveThreshold1
member.summary: Percent of area with dose difference value above a user defined threshold 1 (absolute mode)

member.name: F:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.EvaluationTestKind.DoseDiffAboveThreshold2
member.summary: Percent of area with dose difference value above a user defined threshold 2 (absolute mode)

member.summary: Maximum dose difference value of whole image in relative mode

member.summary: Percent of area with dose difference value above a user defined threshold 1 (relative mode)

member.name: F:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.EvaluationTestKind.DoseDiffAboveThreshold2Relative

member.name: T:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDAnalysis
member.summary: Represents a Portal Dosimetry analysis, a comparison or a dose constancy check.

member.name: F:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDAnalysis.ROIMask_CreateOnAccess
member.summary: Delegate called on first access to the property, must return property value.

member.name: M:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDAnalysis.GetTransferFunction(System.Boolean,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary:
Calculates the transfer function to convert raw pixel values to dose values according to the normalization method of the analysis:
Dose value = raw value * slope + intercept
See remarks section for more information on the usage of this method.
member.param: If true, the transfer function for the reference dose image is returned, if false the transfer function for the portal dose image is returned.
Slope of the linear transfer function.
Intercept of the linear transfer function.
member.remarks:
For CU mode, the transfer function returns Gy (predicted dose), respectively CU (portal dose) values. For relative mode, the resulting dose values are in the range [0, 1].
Note that the transfer function only needs to be applied to the portal dose and the reference dose image of the analysis. For the GammaImage, DoseDiffImage and ReferenceImageOnPortalDoseImageGrid images, the method can be directly used to calculate dose values from raw values.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDAnalysis.PDAnalysisMethodImpl
member.summary: Injected class method implementation.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDAnalysis.SummaryResult
member.summary: The summary test result of the evaluation tests. The analysis is failed if one or more of the tests failed.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDAnalysis.IsPrimary
member.summary: Flag if this is the primary analysis for the portal dose image.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDAnalysis.IsComparison
member.summary: Flag if this analysis is a comparison against another portal dose image or against another predicted dose image than the predicted dose of the beam.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDAnalysis.IsConstancyCheck
member.summary: Flag if this analysis is a constancy check using a baseline portal dose image as reference.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDAnalysis.CreatorUserName
member.summary: The creator of the analysis.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDAnalysis.CreationDate
member.summary: The date/time the analysis was performed.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDAnalysis.AlignmentDone
member.summary: Gets if image alignment (imager position correction) was done during the analysis.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDAnalysis.IDULat
member.summary: The portal dose IDU lateral value used during this analysis. This value can be different to the value in the portal dose image.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDAnalysis.IDULng
member.summary: The portal dose IDU longitudinal value used during this analysis. This value can be different to the value in the portal dose image.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDAnalysis.IDURtn
member.summary: The portal dose IDU rotation value used during this analysis. This value can be different to the value in the portal dose image.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDAnalysis.Mode
member.summary: The analysis mode: CU mode or relative mode.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDAnalysis.NormalizationMethod
member.summary: The dose normalization method used for this analysis (only relevant in relative mode).

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDAnalysis.NormalizationPoint
member.summary: The dose normalization point in DICOM coordinates when the normalization method is set to 'Point', a vector of NaN otherwise.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDAnalysis.NormalizationFactorRefDose
member.summary: The additional normalization factor applied to the reference dose image. Only used in relative mode.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDAnalysis.NormalizationFactorPortDose
member.summary: The additional normalization factor applied to the portal dose image. Only used in relative mode.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDAnalysis.ROIType
member.summary: The type of region of interest used for the analysis.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDAnalysis.UserROI
member.summary: The user ROI rectangle if one is defined (in pixel coordinates). Only valid if ROIType is set to 'User'.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDAnalysis.FieldROIMargin
member.summary: The margin around the field outline when the field ROI or CIAO ROI type is used (millimeters).

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDAnalysis.UseThreshold
member.summary: True if a threshold value is used. If true, the final ROI is defined as the pixels having a dose larger than the threshold value and located inside of the ROI.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDAnalysis.Threshold
member.summary: The ROI threshold value in percents (0 to 1, 1 means 100 %), double.NaN if none.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDAnalysis.ROIMask
member.summary: The ROI as two dimensional mask [x, y], 1 means inside ROI and threshold, 0 means outside. The mask has the same size as the portal dose image.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDAnalysis.GammaParamDoseDiff
member.summary: The maximum allowed dose difference (in percents [0 to 1, 1 means 100 %] of reference dose) in the Gamma analysis.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDAnalysis.GammaParamDTA
member.summary: The 'distance to agreement' parameter value (in millimeters) in the Gamma analysis.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDAnalysis.GammaParamHistogramCutoff
member.summary: The histogram cutoff parameter (in percents, 0 .. 1, 1 means 100 %) in the Gamma analysis.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDAnalysis.GammaLocalLowerThreshold
member.summary: The lower threshold parameter (in percents of max reference dose, 0 .. 1, 1 means 100 %) in the local Gamma analysis.
member.remarks: In local Gamma analysis the GammaParamDoseDiff parameter is in percents of the local pixel dose value in the reference image if the dose value of the pixel is larger than GammaLocalLowerThreshold * MaxReferenceDose. If the pixel dose value is smaller, the used threshold value is (GammaLocalLowerThreshold * GammaParamDoseDiff) of the max dose.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDAnalysis.GammaLocalReference
member.summary: True if local Gamma analysis, false if global (standard) Gamma analysis.
member.remarks: For local Gamma analysis, the GammaParamDoseDiff parameter is in percents of the local pixel dose value in the reference image. For global Gamma analysis, the GammaParamDoseDiff parameter is in percents of the maximum dose in the reference image.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDAnalysis.EvaluationTests
member.summary: The evaluation tests performed in this analysis.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDAnalysis.PortalDoseImage
member.summary: The portal dose image of the analysis.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDAnalysis.ReferenceImage
member.summary: The reference image of the analysis. Typically a predicted dose. When comparing two portal doses in an analysis, the reference image is also a portal dose.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDAnalysis.ReferenceImageOnPortalDoseImageGrid
member.summary: The reference image of the analysis resampled on the pixel grid of the portal dose image.
member.remarks: This image can be compared to the portal dose image pixel by pixel. Consider that raw pixel values cannot be compared directly; raw pixel values of this image must be converted to dose values using respectively the linear transfer function () for portal and reference doses when normalization needs to be considered.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDAnalysis.GammaImage
member.summary: Gamma analysis image.
member.remarks: The gamma image has the same resolution, size and transformation to the Dicom coordinate system as the portal dose image.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDAnalysis.DoseDiffImage
member.summary: Dose difference image.
member.remarks: The dose difference image has the same resolution, size and transformation to the Dicom coordinate system as the portal dose image.

member.name: T:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDAnalysis.IPDAnalysisImpl
member.summary: Interface used to inject the implementation of the public class methods.

member.name: T:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDTemplate
member.summary: Represents a template for performing a Portal Dosimetry analysis.
Creates a new instance of the class. Refer to the class property documentation for a description of the constructor arguments.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDTemplate.ConstancyCheck
member.summary: Flag if this template is used for dose constancy check (true) or for normal analysis (false).

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDTemplate.AlignmentNeeded
member.summary: Flag if auto alignment (imager position correction) shall be done when applying this template.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDTemplate.AlignToSetupImage
member.summary: Flag if alignment is done against a setup image (true) or against the predicted dose image (false). The value of this flag is ignored when AlignmentNeeded is set to false. When set to true, a setup image must be available else applying the template fails.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDTemplate.Mode
member.summary: The analysis mode the template can be used for: CU, Gy or relative mode.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDTemplate.NormalizationMethod
member.summary: The dose normalization method using for this analysis. Only used in relative analysis mode. 'Point' normalization mode is not supported in templates.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDTemplate.UseThreshold
member.summary: True if a threshold value is used as ROI.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDTemplate.Threshold
member.summary: The ROI threshold value in percent (0 to 1), double.NaN if none.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDTemplate.ROIType
member.summary: The type of region of interest used for the analysis. 'User' ROI mode is not supported in templates.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDTemplate.FieldROIMargin
member.summary: The margin around the field outline when the field ROI or CIAO ROI type is used (millimeters).

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDTemplate.GammaParamDoseDiff
member.summary: The maximum allowed dose difference (in percent [0 to 1] of reference max) in the Gamma analysis.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDTemplate.GammaParamDTA
member.summary: The 'distance to agreement' parameter value (in millimeters) in the Gamma analysis.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDTemplate.GammaLocalReference
member.summary: True if local Gamma analysis, false if global (standard) Gamma analysis.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDTemplate.EvaluationTests
member.summary: Evaluation tests to be performed as part of the analysis.

member.summary: Represents a portal dose image in the Portal Dosimetry application.

member.summary: Delegate called on first access to the property, must return property value.

member.name: M:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PortalDoseImage.TransformToPredictedDose(VMS.CA.Scripting.VVector)
member.summary: Transforms a point from the portal dose Dicom coordinate system to the predicted dose Dicom coordinate system.
member.param: Point in Dicom coordinates of portal dose.
member.returns: Point in Dicom coordinates of predicted dose.

member.name: M:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PortalDoseImage.TransformToPortalDose(VMS.CA.Scripting.VVector)
member.summary: Transforms a point from the predicted dose Dicom coordinate system to the portal dose Dicom coordinate system.
member.param: Point in Dicom coordinates of predicted dose.
member.returns: Point in Dicom coordinates of portal dose.

member.name: M:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PortalDoseImage.TransformToReferenceImage(VMS.CA.Scripting.VVector)
member.summary: Transforms a point from the portal dose Dicom coordinate system to the beam reference image Dicom coordinate system.
member.param: Point in Dicom coordinates of portal dose.
member.returns: Point in Dicom coordinates of the beam reference image.
member.remarks: Throws an exception when the beam has no reference image.

member.name: M:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PortalDoseImage.TransformFromReferenceImage(VMS.CA.Scripting.VVector)
member.summary: Transforms a point from the beam reference image Dicom coordinate system to the portal dose Dicom coordinate system.
member.param: Point in Dicom coordinates of the beam reference image.
member.returns: Point in Dicom coordinates of the portal dose.
member.remarks: Throws an exception when the beam has no reference image.

member.name: M:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PortalDoseImage.CreateTransientAnalysis(VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDTemplate,VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.DoseImage)
member.summary: Creates a transient analysis using the parameters given by the template. When creation of the analysis fails (e.g. because auto alignment fails), an exception is thrown.
member.param: The template for performing the analysis.
The reference image of the analysis. Typically this is the predicted dose image.
member.returns: The created analysis. The analysis will not be attached to the Analyses collection of the portal dose image!

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PortalDoseImage.PortalDoseImageMethodImpl
member.summary: Injected class method implementation.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PortalDoseImage.CanUseAbsoluteMode
member.summary: Gets if this portal dose image and the assigned predicted dose image can be used in absolute dosimetric mode.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PortalDoseImage.AlignmentNeeded
member.summary: Gets if the portal dose image should be aligned to the predicted dose before doing an analysis.
member.remarks: Alignment is needed when the image is not yet aligned and when the imager is configured for alignment.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PortalDoseImage.Session
member.summary: Used for navigation to the session.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PortalDoseImage.Analyses
member.summary: The portal dose analyses attached to this image.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PortalDoseImage.PredictedDoseImage
member.summary: The predicted dose image that is assigned to this portal dose image. Null when no predicted dose is available

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PortalDoseImage.DefaultTemplate
member.summary: The default template to be used to create analyses for this portal dose image. If the plan of the image has a template assigned, this template is returned, else the default template is returned.

member.name: T:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PortalDoseImage.IPortalDoseImageImpl
member.summary: Interface used to inject the implementation of the public class methods.

member.name: T:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.ScriptContext
member.summary: A class that contains the context information for the script. Used for plug-in scripts running in the context of an application.

member.name: M:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.ScriptContext.#ctor(VMS.CA.Scripting.User,VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.Patient,VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDPlanSetup,VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDBeam,VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.DoseImage,VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDAnalysis)
member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: Current user
Current patient
Current plan
Current beam
Current dose image
Current analysis

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.ScriptContext.Patient
member.summary: The patient. The value may be null if the context has no patient.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.ScriptContext.PDPlanSetup
member.summary: The plan. The value may be null if the context has no plan.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.ScriptContext.PDBeam
member.summary: The beam. The value may be null if the context has no beam.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.ScriptContext.DoseImage
member.summary: The dose image - either prediced or portal dose. The value may be null if the context has no dose image.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.ScriptContext.Analysis
member.summary: The analysis. The value may be null if the context has no analysis.
member.remarks:
This object represents the analysis with parameters as currently set on the Portal Dosimetry user interface. If an analysis is selected in the dose image panel, this object is a copy of the selected analysis because the original analysis parameters may have been modified on the user interface.
If no analysis is selected but the active portal dose image has a predicted dose image assigned, this object represents a transient analysis. This object is null when a predicted dose or a portal dose with no predicted dose is selected.

member.name: T:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDPlanSetup
member.summary:
Represents a Portal Dosimetry plan setup object as shown in the user interface. Contains the beam, session and composite image object collections.
Wraps a plan object of type .
member.remarks: This object only exists for plans having at least one dose image (predicted and/or portal dose image).

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDPlanSetup.Patient
member.summary: Used for navigating to the parent patient.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDPlanSetup.Beams
member.summary: The list of Portal Dosimetry beam objects of this plan.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDPlanSetup.Sessions
member.summary: The list of Portal Dosimetry sessions of this plan.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDPlanSetup.CompositeImages
member.summary: The list of composite images created with images of this plan.

member.name: P:VMS.DV.PD.Scripting.PDPlanSetup.PlanSetup
member.summary: Used for navigating to wrapped plan setup.
